title: Bill O'Reilly is left red-faced after calling Beto O'Rourke a liar but photo proves him wrong
text:
Bill O'Reilly was eviscerated on Twitter after he suggested that presidential nominee hopeful Beto O'Rourke was lying about having met a woman raising a special needs child while working four jobs.

The controversial pundit took to his social media after the Democratic Presidential Candidate Debate in Ohio to voice his doubt at O'Rourke's claim.

'Beto says he met a woman working FOUR jobs,' O'Reilly said in the tweet. 'And raising a special needs child. I don’t believe him. Sorry.'

'Beto says he met a woman working FOUR jobs,' O'Reilly said in the tweet. 'And raising a special needs child. I don’t believe him. Sorry'

Rob Flaherty - the former representative's digital director - quickly retweeted O'Reilly's tweet and included a photo of O'Rourke with the woman in question.

'I was there,' he said in the tweet. 'Her name was Gina. Her daughter is named Summer. Here's their picture. A*****e.'

Flaherty's has since been shared more than 2,200 times and has more than 12,000 likes.

People flocked to his comments and O'Reilly's initial post to blast the pundit for his incendiary remarks.

Rob Flaherty - the former representative's digital director - quickly retweeted O'Reilly's tweet and included a photo of O'Rourke with the woman in question

O'Rouke had shared his meeting the woman when asked whether he believed taxing the wealthy would be the best way to address income inequality.

The politician said Senator Elizabeth Warren was more concerned with 'being punitive' than she was with lifting people up before mentioning the woman.

'I think of a woman that I met in Las Vegas, Nevada,' he said. She's working four jobs, raising her child with disabilities, and any American with disabilities knows just how hard it is to make it and get by in this country already.

'Some of those jobs working for some of these corporations, she wants to know how we are going to help her, how we're going to make sure that her child has the care that she needs, that we strengthen protections for those with disabilities, that she just has to work one job because it pays a living wage.'
description: The controversial pundit took to his social media after the Democratic Presidential Candidate Debate in Ohio to voice his doubt at O'Rourke's claim about meeting the Las Vegas woman.
